channel.title: Inference — AI Newsletter
channel.description: The signal in the noise. Curated AI trends, tools, and research — updated every Monday.

item.title: OpenAI policy exec who opposed chatbot’s “adult mode” reportedly fired on discrimination claim
item.description: The executive has denied the allegation that she engaged in discrimination.
item.author: Lucas Ropek

item.title: Introducing SyGra Studio
item.description: Introducing SyGra Studio. Published on the Hugging Face blog covering open-source ML tools and models.

item.title: Implementing the Snake Game in Python
item.description: An easy step-by-step guide to building the snake game from scratch.
item.author: Mahnoor Javed

item.title: Uncertainty-Aware Multimodal Emotion Recognition through Dirichlet Parameterization
item.description: In this work, we present a lightweight and privacy-preserving Multimodal Emotion Recognition (MER) framework designed for deployment on edge devices. To demonstrate framework's versatility, our implementation uses three modalities - speech, text and facial imagery.
item.author: Remi Grzeczkowicz, Eric Soriano, Ali Janati et al.

item.title: ONNX Based Generative AI LLMs in Java with Project Babylon by Adam Sotona [video]
item.description: ONNX Based Generative AI LLMs in Java with Project Babylon by Adam Sotona [video]. Published by Hacker News (AI).

item.title: ClawRouter
item.description: Smart LLM router — save 78% on inference costs. 30+ models, one wallet, x402 micropayments. (2,135 stars, 213 forks, TypeScript) Just 7 days old — gaining ~305 stars/day.
item.author: BlockRunAI

item.title: Facebook can animate your profile pic with AI
item.description: Facebook is rolling out new AI features that let you animate your profile picture and restyle Stories and Memories. You'll also be able to add animated backgrounds to text posts to make them pop in the feed. With the animated profile pictures, you'll be able to give a still photo motion with some preset types […].
item.author: Jay Peters

item.title: Helping kids and teens learn and grow online on Safer Internet Day
item.description: User profile on smartphone connected to security, media, and settings icons.
item.author: Mindy Brooks, Jennifer Flannery O'Connor

item.title: 629+ MCP Servers Exist. There Was No Directory. Until Now.
item.description: If you're building AI agents with the Model Context Protocol (MCP), you've probably hit this problem: You need a capability. You know someone built it. But you have no idea where to find it.
item.author: Kai

item.title: Shape, Symmetries, and Structure: The Changing Role of Mathematics in Machine Learning Research
item.description: What is the Role of Mathematics in Modern Machine Learning? The past decade has witnessed a shift in how progress is made in machine learning.
item.author: Henry Kvinge

item.title: Claude Code costs up to $200 a month. Goose does the same thing for free.
item.description: The artificial intelligence coding revolution comes with a catch: it's expensive. Claude Code , Anthropic's terminal-based AI agent that can write, debug, and deploy code autonomously, has captured the imagination of software developers worldwide.
item.author: Michael Nuñez

item.title: LangSmith is Now Available in Google Cloud Marketplace
item.description: Today, we're thrilled to announce that LangSmith, the agent engineering platform from LangChain, is available in Google Cloud Marketplace.
item.author: LangChain Accounts

item.title: Google AI Introduces Natively Adaptive Interfaces (NAI): An Agentic Multimodal Accessibility Framework Built on Gemini for Adaptive UI Design
item.description: Google Research is proposing a new way to build accessible software with Natively Adaptive Interfaces (NAI), an agentic framework where a multimodal AI agent becomes the primary user interface and adapts the application in real time to each user’s abilities and context.
item.author: Asif Razzaq

item.title: RFK Jr. Says Americans Need More Protein. His Grok-Powered Food Website Disagrees
item.description: The site Realfood.gov uses Elon Musk’s Grok chatbot to dispense nutrition information—some of which contradicts the government’s new guidelines.
item.author: Emily Mullin

item.title: GeForce NOW Celebrates Six Years of Streaming With 24 Games in February
item.description: Break out the cake and green sprinkles — GeForce NOW is turning six. Since launch, members have streamed over 1 billion hours, and the party’s just getting started. Throughout February, members can look forward to new games, fresh ways to play across more devices and even more ways to bring RTX power to every screen Read Article.
item.author: GeForce NOW Community

item.title: Yet another co-founder departs Elon Musk's xAI
item.description: Tony Wu leaves a company now entangled with social media, space-based IPOs.
item.author: Kyle Orland

item.title: A “QuitGPT” campaign is urging people to cancel their ChatGPT subscriptions
item.description: In September, Alfred Stephen, a freelance software developer in Singapore, purchased a ChatGPT Plus subscription, which costs $20 a month and offers more access to advanced models, to speed up his work. But he grew frustrated with the chatbot’s coding abilities and its gushing, meandering replies. Then he came across a post on Reddit about….
item.author: Michelle Kim

item.title: How and When the Memory Chip Shortage Will End
item.description: If it feels these days as if everything in technology is about AI, that’s because it is. And nowhere is that more true than in the market for computer memory.
item.author: Samuel K. Moore

item.title: Bringing ChatGPT to GenAI.mil
item.description: OpenAI for Government announces the deployment of a custom ChatGPT on GenAI.mil, bringing secure, safety-forward AI to U.S.

item.title: Project Genie: Experimenting with infinite, interactive worlds
item.description: Google AI Ultra subscribers in the U.S. can try out Project Genie, an experimental research prototype that lets you create and explore worlds.
